question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
The lattice shown is continued for $9$ rows. What will be the third number in the $9$th row? \begin{tabular}{rccccc}
Row 1: & 1 & 2 & 3 & 4 & 5 \\
Row 2: & 6 & 7 & 8 & 9 & 10 \\
Row 3: & 11 & 12 & 13 & 14 & 15 \\
Row 4: & 16 & 17 & 18 & 19 & 20
\end{tabular}
inference:
Each row consists of $5$ elements.
The first element in each row is the last element of the previous row plus $1$.
The third element in each row is the first element in that row plus $2$.
Therefore, the third element in the $9$th row is $9$th row first element plus $2$.
9th row first element $=41$
Third element $=41+2=43$
**Final Answer: \\boxed{$43$}. I hope it is correct.**
ground_truth: Notice that the last element in row $i$ is equal to $5i$. Thus, the last element in the $9$th row is equal to $5 \times 9 = 45$. The third number in the same row is just two smaller than the last element of the row, so the answer is $45-2 = \boxed{43}$.
